channel.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
channel.description:
The last few months I have attempted to get somewhere with (X)HTML and CSS since I suck at it. So what I managed to come up with, is a basic layout and design that I have been considering porting to PHP (it is currently (X)HTML as it is a mockup).
What I would like is to hear your opinions about this layout and design. What would you change? What would you keep the same? If you would want to change anything, then if you could, please, let me know why - that would be awesome...
Also, you should just ignore what is actually written, because yes, it is Swedish, and no, what's written is so not important! When this site goes "live", the main language on it will be English - and what's currently written will not even be translated; it will be removed.
To take into consideration, is that this design and layout has been hand-crafted (no tools used to generate the code) and supports the majority of browsers out there (yes, including IE6 and its broken DOM-structure). It should also validate (X)HTML and CSS correctly aswell as support the majority of the screen-resolutions out there.
The address is: www.macroing.org
Before you ask: No, this website is not about anything related to RuneScape. Why I called it Macroing.org (and Macroing.net) is another story...

item.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

[quote=“Tenen, post:27, topic:327221”][quote author=object link=topic=423616.msg3122792#msg3122792 date=1265703676]
what with my code is so clean? I just try to follow the standards - nothing extraordinary about that…
[/quote]
he’s probs from moparscape and you know what happens down there ;)[/quote]

curse you sir thats an insult. I had some interest in rsps years ago, but for the past couple of years i’ve been more serious with programming. A great majority of Moparscapers can’t program even if their life depended on it. I’m currently doing coop for an anti spy/adware company … as ironic it may sound, my job is to write malicious code (still in my 2 months of training period though :P) planning to go into info security… if my code was messy, i’d get shot >.<

Anyways, by neat i meant how organized you were with your css and divs. I am strict on good programming habits, except for when it comes to html. even my PHP is somewhat neat just the html i am not so passionate for.

Read full topic

item.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

quest rs: Ah I see… Weird is though, when you said you’re creating a “project featuring site”, that sounds just like what I have planned to do myself. I am also going to add my own forum system to this system. My first PHP-project was a forum system (although it sucked since that was my first real website attempt - I am not a web developer).

And also, you said you have used Photoshop, but it was long ago. I have never even used it once. So I guess that’s not a great excuse for not trying. Last but not “least”; what with my code is so clean? I just try to follow the standards - nothing extraordinary about that…

Read full topic
item.source: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout

item.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

I was not serious about leeching it… but I did mean to sarcastically ask for your permission to use it. The site is just a project featuring site, im more into back-end programming than interface (photoshop + html was too long ago for me to do it cleanly :(!) I am more interested into custom software so currently working on a forum/cms system that will be available in forms of sepereate mudles that can be added or removed like smf’s packages and I noticed how clean your coding was.

In either case, I liked the idea od simplicity and it will definitely be reflective in my next site -dont worry, no leaching… promise-

Read full topic
item.source: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout

item.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

Tenen: Yeah, I read what was written on that page. But when you think about it, they’re not even compliant with the standards themselves. So I guess I will continue to support IE6.

quest rs: Thanks! And I prefer if you do not leech it. It after all took me several months to create (yes, I know, I suck at it :)). But out of curiosity, what is your website about?

Eh Pretty Easy: Thanks! I can imagine - Swedish isn’t really the easiest language to learn. But then also, what’s written at the moment isn’t of high importance. I am going to switch to English when I have something actually worth showing.

Read full topic

item.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Try bold 10px white/light grey and go through a few web fonts to see if anything works. Calibri would probably be the best but I think that’s only available on machines with Office 2007 or Vista so try Tahoma, Verdana, Arial etc.

If it doesn’t look good then just get rid of it, but it’s worth a try rather than leaving a blank space.

Read full topic
item.source: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout

item.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

inertia: I cannot really find any good font (color, size, family etc) for that. And wouldn’t it look a little bit messy too?

Unhandled: I am not sure what you mean, but I hope my new update fixed it. If you were referring to the background image with a gradient, it would already be at the bottom of the site - and in my opinion, it would already be the footer (which means there would be nothing below it).

fellixombc: I hope I fixed what you and Unhandled both agreed on. And I also fixed the border. It is now gone. It did fit well in the beginning though. But as the design change, so does the layout.

lawl: Yep, I like simple too! However, what’d you suggest to decrease its boring-ness?

Everyone: I havn’t checked up whether it does work well on IE6 this time or not. So if anyone here uses IE6 and notice that, you don’t have to tell me about it. I will look that up myself when I get the time to do so.

Read full topic

item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Hardly anyone uses IE6 and those who do will have trouble viewing a lot of websites anyway, so it’s their own fault for not upgrading.

2e5p9iu.png884×443

(january - my site)

Don’t let ie limitations spoil your site, fuck the faggots who wont upgrade.

Read full topic
item.source: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout

item.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

inertia: You’re very right about its state; it doesn’t look finished simply because it isn’t. Why it isn’t finished, is because it’s a mockup. And a mockup usually tend to be a set of static webpages (which also explains why I didn’t write it in PHP directly) - showing their layout, design and flow (although I omitted their flow this time).

When it comes to actual content, I have planned to add a panel similar to the one containing the HTML-validation image, but instead containing components for logging in. And when you’re logged in, it should contain other panels with information about your account etc. Here the PHP comes in…

Another thought I had, was to add the option for a matching image to the left of the news-posts. It would indeed make it look less empty. And the third thought I had, was to perhaps change the default buttons with some other gradient image, as they look quite similar to the gradient image in the menu background.

Greeny: Yes, I thought the same at first. But, seeing as not everyone uses later versions than IE6 (I know, I didn’t not too long ago - and… Shame on me for that), it would be better to support it than not to. I mean, more people would be able to view my website without feeling forced to update their browser. Plus, it makes it seem more “professional” to me.

Read full topic

item.title: [Request] Your thoughts on my design and layout
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

I can’t really complain about anything apart from the width, although it doesn’t look finished.

If you’re really struggling to make it smaller, at least fill the page with more stuff like panels with extra funky info and pics in them.

Ps, what do you mean by porting it to PHP? I originally thought you had pages hidden in JavaScript and clicking the links would show these pages, but it’s just a static page so I don’t understand what would be different about this in PHP =/

Read full topic
